answers.author: Jayme Bosio
answers.text:
Palm Beach County, FL, Government has an "Art in Public Places" Division with a mission to "provide art that complements public buildings, parks and plazas, and creates a sense of place and enhances community identity..." Their web site profiles several interesting programs and services which may be of use to the City of Walnut Creek. Web address: http://www.pbcgov.com/fdo/art/ . (Includes Contacts)

author: Kevin Safine
text:
The City of Walnut Creek, California is interested in learning about other cities' walking historical/art tours. Currently, many of our buildings and sites have bronze plaques installed by the owners with no consistency as to message or what qualifies as "historical", or as "public art". 
We would like to find what other cities are doing with regard to historic and/or public art tours (particularly in downtowns), as far as markings, signage, self guided tours and other printed or electronic material. Ideas, links to your information, or contact info will be especially helpful.
Thank you!
title: Downtown Historical/Art Tours
